Instruction: In the file "EF34GH.pdf", on page 8, within the fourth rectangle, add a table with the following content: first row "Column, Height"; second row "C1, 3m"; third row "C2, 4.5m"; adjust the row heights to [25, 20, 20].
Groundtruth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "EF34GH.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information
pagenumber = 7  # Page 8 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 3  # Fourth rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Table content
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[["Column", "Height"], ["C1", "3m"], ["C2", "4.5m"]],
    arrange=[[25, 20, 20], None]
)

# Adding the table
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data"),
    arrange=argument.get("arrange")
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)
Response_code:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# Task 1
# file-level
filepath = "EF34GH.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# page-level: page 8 -> pagenumber=7 (0-indexed)
pagenumber = 7
# order-level: fourth rectangle -> rectangleorder=3 (0-indexed)
rectangleorder = 3
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# base-level: table content and row heights
data = [["Column", "Height"], ["C1", "3m"], ["C2", "4.5m"]]
arrange = [[25, 20, 20], None]  # row heights provided, column width not specified

# Prepare arguments dictionary with provided parameters only
argument = {
    "clip": rectangle,
    "data": data,
    "arrange": arrange
}

# Create table manipulator with required and provided optional parameters
table_adder = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument["clip"],
    data=argument["data"],
    arrange=argument["arrange"]
)
doc = table_adder.addtable()

# Save updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

import PDFbf

    data=[

# base-level: table content and formatting

}

    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    data=argument.get("data"),
    arrange=argument.get("arrange"),
    font=argument.get("font"),
    fontsize=argument.get("fontsize")
)

doc.save(updated_file)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "AB12CD.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information
pagenumber = 1  # Page 2 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 4  # Fifth rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# First table content
argument1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[
        ["Pipe ID", "Diameter", "Material"],
        ["P1", "200mm", "PVC"],
        ["P2", "250mm", "Steel"]
    ],
    arrange=[None, [60, 70, 70]],  # Column widths
    font="Arial",
    fontsize=12
)

# Adding the first table
table_adder1 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument1.get("clip"),
    data=argument1.get("data"),
    arrange=argument1.get("arrange"),
    font=argument1.get("font"),
    fontsize=argument1.get("fontsize")
)
doc = table_adder1.addtable()

# Second table content
argument2 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[
        ["Valve ID", "Type", "Size"],
        ["V1", "Gate", "DN200"],
        ["V2", "Butterfly", "DN250"]
    ],
    arrange=[[28, 24, 24], None]  # Row heights
)

# Adding the second table
table_adder2 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument2.get("clip"),
    data=argument2.get("data"),
    arrange=argument2.get("arrange")
)
doc = table_adder2.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File-level information
filepath = "EF34GH.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Page-level and order-level information
pagenumber = 6  # Page 7 (0-based index)
rectangleorder = 1  # Second rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# First table content
argument1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[
        ["Load Case", "Description"],
        ["LC1", "Dead Load"],
        ["LC2", "Live Load"]
    ],
    font="Times New Roman",
    fontsize=11
)

# Adding the first table
table_adder1 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument1.get("clip"),
    data=argument1.get("data"),
    font=argument1.get("font"),
    fontsize=argument1.get("fontsize")
)
doc = table_adder1.addtable()

# Second table content
argument2 = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    data=[
        ["Combination", "Factor"],
        ["LC1+LC2", "1.5"],
        ["LC1+0.5LC2", "1.2"]
    ],
    arrange=[None, [80, 80]]  # Uniform column widths
)

# Adding the second table
table_adder2 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument2.get("clip"),
    data=argument2.get("data"),
    arrange=argument2.get("arrange")
)
doc = table_adder2.addtable()

# Save the updated file
updated_file = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_file)

In the files "IJ56KL.pdf" and "MN78OP.pdf", on page 2 within rectangle 5 of "IJ56KL.pdf", and on page 6 within rectangle 2 of "MN78OP.pdf", add a different table at each position:

import fitz
import PDFbf

# File 1: IJ56KL.pdf
filepath1 = "IJ56KL.pdf"
doc1 = fitz.open(filepath1)

# Annotation extractor for the first file
annoextractor1 = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc1)

# Page-level and order-level information for Rectangle 5 in IJ56KL.pdf
pagenumber1 = 1  # Page 2 (0-based index)
rectangleorder1 = 4  # Fifth rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle for the first table
rectangle1, rfpoint1 = annoextractor1.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber1, rectangleorder=rectangleorder1)

# First table content
argument1 = dict(
    clip=rectangle1,
    data=[
        ["Equipment ID", "Power", "Efficiency"],
        ["EQ01", "5 kW", "85%"],
        ["EQ02", "7.5 kW", "90%"]
    ],
    arrange=[[30, 25, 25], [80, 60, 70]],  # Adjusting row heights and column widths
    font="Calibri",
    fontsize=11
)

# Adding the first table
table_adder1 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc1,
    pagenumber=pagenumber1,
    clip=argument1.get("clip"),
    data=argument1.get("data"),
    arrange=argument1.get("arrange"),
    font=argument1.get("font"),
    fontsize=argument1.get("fontsize")
)
doc1 = table_adder1.addtable()

# Save the updated file for IJ56KL.pdf
updated_file1 = filepath1[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc1.save(updated_file1)

# File 2: MN78OP.pdf
filepath2 = "MN78OP.pdf"
doc2 = fitz.open(filepath2)

# Annotation extractor for the second file
annoextractor2 = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc2)

# Page-level and order-level information for Rectangle 2 in MN78OP.pdf
pagenumber2 = 5  # Page 6 (0-based index)
rectangleorder2 = 1  # Second rectangle (0-based index)

# Extracting target rectangle for the second table
rectangle2, rfpoint2 = annoextractor2.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber2, rectangleorder=rectangleorder2)

# Second table content
argument2 = dict(
    clip=rectangle2,
    data=[
        ["Pipe ID", "Diameter", "Material"],
        ["P101", "100 mm", "PVC"],
        ["P102", "150 mm", "HDPE"]
    ],
    fontsize=10  # Font size
)

# Adding the second table
table_adder2 = PDFbf.manipulate_table(
    doc=doc2,
    pagenumber=pagenumber2,
    clip=argument2.get("clip"),
    data=argument2.get("data"),
    fontsize=argument2.get("fontsize")
)
doc2 = table_adder2.addtable()

# Save the updated file for MN78OP.pdf
updated_file2 = filepath2[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc2.save(updated_file2)
